Dialogue: Dad?

Speaker: leroy
Dialogue: Shut up    and listen to me. There was one    night, 1960. I remember because    it was August and Chubby Checker    just dropped "the twist".

Dialogue: Worse thing I ever seen. And the smell, that awful smell -- all cooked flesh. Somehow we ended up in the water.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What truth?

Dialogue: I saw something, Mikey. Through the smoke and the burning. Something I can't even really explain, but it was there, Dickie saw it, too.

Dialogue: What did you see?

Dialogue: Mr. Hanlon, you ready?

Dialogue: I saw what was really responsible for that fire, Mikey. Not the Legion. See those white boys, they were there, but there was something else, orchestrating `em. Had `em all in a fit and frenzy, moved to his whims. This thing, I don't even know how to describe it...

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Mr. Hanlon?

Dialogue: Be careful out there son. Especially by the canal. The water in Derry is no place for no one, especially a youngster like you.

Dialogue: Somebody! HELP! Let me out!  Dad! Mom!

Dialogue: Tilt down to the OVERHEAD shot of what we expect to be "Derry 1988", but instead we see forests, logging trails, a hardscrabble 19th century downtown, and a LOG CABIN SALOON squatting on the edge of the swollen Kenduskeag canal. Smoke billows from its chimney, day drawing down to a misty dark.

Dialogue: He didn't run away, sir! He's just a child, missing now for more than three days!
And walks into the saloon, "SILVER DOLLAR" carved deep and poorly into the wood over the door.

Dialogue: And that is the story of the Silver Dollar Saloon.

Dialogue: Just like my pa was trying to warn me the night I met you guys.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: That clown, whatever "IT" is, has been around Derry doing nasty things for a long long time. The Black Spot fire. The Bradley Gang massacre. All the way back to the first settlers who disappeared.

Speaker: richie
Dialogue: Whatevs. It sounds like bunk to me. Didn't the guy who wrote this go insane or something?

Dialogue: Exactly. No one listened to him like no one listens to us. And unless we do something, "IT's" never going to stop.

Dialogue: What do you mean, us, Will?    We're just kids.

Dialogue: We hurt it at Neibolt.   That's gotta mean something.

Dialogue: Everything dies.

Dialogue: We can kill it.

Speaker: richie
Dialogue: Okay Schwarzenegger twins, simmer down. We can't even free Eddie from "mom jail" let alone take down some freaky shape-shifter with a mind- meld on all the adults of Derry. However, I do believe we could sell this story to "Tales from the crypt."

Dialogue: Willy, we need a minute--

Dialogue: And Georgie right? You, dad, and Georgie.

Dialogue: Willy, stop.

Dialogue: No. You stop. I hate   it. Tip toeing around you guys like   I don't exist. Like I'm the one who   died and the only one who's still   here is Ge--

Dialogue: I miss Georgie, too.

Dialogue: We know.

Dialogue: Do you? Because it seems like every adult in this town is blind to what's really happening, blind to what any of us kids are going through.

Speaker: will

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: No.   Feels fine I guess.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I'm not allowed to see them.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: My Mom thinks they're the reason I got hurt. She says I'm sensitive and they don't take care of me like she does.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Yeah. Mom says I should always carry my Epi-pen with me, in case I ever have an episode.

Dialogue: Hold it there, butt cheese.

Dialogue: My dad saw it near water, too.      The canal.

Dialogue: Unless you live way out in the sticks like I do. We have to tell the others.

Dialogue: I wasn't invited.

Dialogue: I know daddy.

Dialogue: They're my friends, daddy.

Dialogue: I-- I swear. They're just friends.

Dialogue: I'm a good girl daddy. Good, just like you raised me.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: WHERE'D YOU--

Dialogue: It's nothing, daddy.   Just a poem.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: I told you I don't have one.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Daddy stop. You're hurting me.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Nothing. Please, daddy. You don't have to worry. I promise. Please!

Dialogue: What?

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Daddy, please.

Dialogue: Not me, momma... You.

Dialogue: He said I was never allergic until you made me start carrying around my Epi-pen. You put those allergies in my head.

Dialogue: Then why did you send my friends away?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: You lied to me mamma. You've been giving me medicine that's not really medicine.

Dialogue: And friggin do what?   In this storm?

Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: will
Dialogue: It's using our fears against us. It wants us to be afraid.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Because we'll taste better.

Speaker: richie
Dialogue: And that's supposed to rally us, Will?

Speaker: will
Dialogue: We have to stick together, to help each other against that kind of fear you only have when you're alone. Alright?

Speaker: pennywise
Dialogue: Welcome to the circus, Willy.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: I'm not afraid of you, clown.

Speaker: pennywise
Dialogue: Your brother wasn't afraid either.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Guys?

Speaker: pennywise
Dialogue: Ooooh I'd love to, Will. I'd just love to show you my deadlights. Only you wouldn't understand. And I need you to, Willy, I really really need you to understand what's going to happen to you. What it means for a little kiddie like you... to float.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Georgie.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Break into our homes, we break into yours.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Charge!

Speaker: pennywise
Dialogue: Wait!

Speaker: pennywise/georgie
Dialogue: Please, Willy. Please don't hurt me.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: You're not Georgie.

Speaker: pennywise/georgie
Dialogue: I am. I'm in here, Willy. We all are. This is the place we float.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Will, it's a trick.

Speaker: pennywise/georgie
Dialogue: It's not your fault Willy. Not you're fault I'm stuck here. But you're hurting us all.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: It's trying to get to you, Will. Kill it. Kill it now.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: No!   I have to think.

Speaker: pennywise/georgie
Dialogue: Mom and dad they should know. They should know it's not your fault. I'll tell `em. I'll tell `em as long as you don't hurt us anymore.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Finish him, Will. For all of us. For Georgie.

Speaker: richie
Dialogue: I'm taking this fucker out.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: georgie
Dialogue: It's okay, Willy. I know. Everything'll be okay.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Hairspray.

Speaker: georgie
Dialogue: No!   No Willy! Please!

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Did we kill it?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You did it, Will.

Speaker: richie
Dialogue: It's miller ti--

Speaker: will
Dialogue: We've got to get out of here.

Speaker: richie
Dialogue: Shit!

Speaker: will
Dialogue: We'll get out. C'mon.

Speaker: stan
Dialogue: We're going to drown down here aren't we?

Speaker: eddie                           mike
Dialogue: I'm so cold.                      All this water. It's still going to win.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: No. I don't know--

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: We're dead. So dead.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Guys, stop it. Focus.

Speaker: richie
Dialogue: Now can we celebrate?

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Will?

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Swear, guys. Swear if IT isn't dead, if it ever returns, we'll come back and fight it together.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: But we beat It.    We beat the cancer.

Speaker: mike's mom
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Derry.   The clown.    It.

Speaker: mike's mom
Dialogue: He's in a better place, Mikey. I know it's hard to believe. But you have to. Remember what your father always said...

Speaker: leroy
Dialogue: See son, everything has a cycle. Just when you think the world couldn't get any colder, something good always grows.

Speaker: september
Dialogue: EXT. WILL'S HOUSE - DAY

Speaker: zach
Dialogue: Load up!

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: We all pitched in.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Well Richie mostly.

Speaker: richie
Dialogue: I had to mow like five hundred lawns. Stan smoked the clippings.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: We hear Arcadia's pretty amazing this time of year.

Speaker: beverly
Dialogue: Take some pictures for us.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: sharon
Dialogue: Willy c'mon!
